alert.note: Alert for Benton; Carroll; Chester; Decatur; Henderson; Henry; Madison; Weakley (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 15 at 10:34PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Weakley, Henderson, Benton, Carroll, northeastern Madison, Henry, northeastern Chester and Decatur Counties through 1115 PM CDT... At 1034 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles southeast of Murray to near Bruceton to near Sardis. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Paris, Lexington, Henderson, McKenzie, Huntingdon, Camden, Natchez Trace State Park, Paris Landing State Park, Natchez Trace State Forest, Parsons, New Johnsonville, Bruceton, Decaturville, Sardis, Cottage Grove, Reagan, Bargerton, Springville, Jacks Creek and Blue Goose. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for west Tennessee.

area.areaDesc: Benton; Carroll; Chester; Decatur; Henderson; Henry; Madison; Weakley
